snippet: The factors making Representative Paul D. Ryan a top contender for the presidency in 2016 could be upended if Republicans conclude they need a less conservative standard-bearer.
abstract: Rep Paul D Ryan, whose political profile has been raised as a result of his selection as Mitt Romney's 2012 presidential running mate, is now situated at forefront of next generation of Republicans; factors making him top contender for presidency in 2016 could work against him if Republicans conclude they need a less conservative standard-bearer.

byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting from Janesville, Wis.

lead_paragraph: The factors making Representative Paul D. Ryan a top contender for the presidency in 2016 could be upended if Republicans conclude they need a less conservative standard-bearer.

headline.seo: Ryan in Republican Forefront, but Loss May Also Bring Blame
headline.main: Ryan in Republican Forefront, but Loss May Bring Blame
headline.print_headline: Ryan in Republican Forefront, But Loss May Bring Blame
